thread.title: Man shot while sleeping in Roseland | Chicago Sun-Times
thread.title_full: Man shot while sleeping in Roseland | Chicago Sun-Times

title: Man shot while sleeping in Roseland | Chicago Sun-Times
text:
Man shot while sleeping in Roseland 
Sun-Times file photo @lukewilusz | Sign-Up for our News & Politics Newsletter Sign-Up 
A man was wounded when a bullet came through a window of a home where he was sleeping early Tuesday in the Roseland neighborhood on the Far South Side. 
The 43-year-old was sleeping at 4:55 a.m. in the front room of a home in the 300 block of West 109th Street when a bullet entered through a front window and struck him in the leg, according to Chicago Police. 
He was taken to Roseland Community Hospital, where his condition was stabilized, police said. Previously from Chicago News
